projects.projectName: May I Have Your Attention, Please?
projects.description: Project for the Marist-IBM Datathon in April 2021. Built a Cascade classifier with OpenCV for object detection of one's eyes. The model was then embedded in a Kivy application that promotes increased attention spans in the digital world.
Data science project where I analyzed the relative stock market performance of the different company sectors in 2020.

Application that enables me to easily automate tests for my programs for my Java development class. The JUnit library was helpful in creating the testing environment as I built off of its testing framework to add the necessary automation capabilities.
This project is the website you are currently on! This was a huge learning experience as I learned how to build websites using the React.js framework.

Application that computes the center of mass of a 2-dimensional plane bounded by polynomial functions. Using the SciPy and Matplotlib modules, I was able to perform all of the complex calculations while still being able to create a nice output for the user to visualize the results.
Horror survival game that is similar to Call of Duty's Zombies mode. The game was developed in a team setting during Marist's pre-college program for game design.
